name: Oregano
climate: Oregano thrives in a Mediterranean climate that is warm and sunny.
It tolerates dry, arid conditions, making it ideal for xeriscaping.
This herb is resilient to droughts, preferring less humid environments.
It grows well in temperate zones with well-defined, seasonal patterns.
sunlight: Oregano requires full sun exposure for at least six hours a day.
The plant grows best in a bright location with direct sunlight.
Although tolerant of partial shade, optimal growth needs direct sun.
In climates with intense sun, some afternoon shade may be tolerated.
watering: Oregano prefers dry to moderately moist conditions, not waterlogged.
Water the plant when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, hence allow soil to dry out.
During growing season, water more frequently but avoid soggy soil.
soil: Oregano grows best in well-draining soil with a neutral pH level.
A sandy or loamy soil is preferable, ensuring proper drainage.
It's adapted to poor to average soil fertility, making it hardy.
Improving drainage through soil amendments is beneficial for growth.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning ensures a bushy, healthy plant with more leaves.
Mulching helps to retain soil moisture and suppresses weeds.
Avoid using rich fertilizers, as they may promote floppy growth.
In colder climates, consider growing oregano indoors during winter.
